result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincen E Reynolds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vincen E Reynolds

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from attorney Thomas Hayes with attachments for sentencing hearing.

Defendant Vincen E Reynolds in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE FILE. Court is in trial and unable to hear this case today. Case adjourned in branch 24.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Per request of defense counsel and no objection from the State, Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing to October 23, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.

Defendant Vincen E Reynolds in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vincen E Reynolds in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense requested a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 24.  Court reiterated the absolute sobriet order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY; not to be in possession of any prescription drugs withouta a valid driver's license; no possession of any firarms or weapons.

Defendant Vincen E Reynolds in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Vincen E Reynolds
Current: 5152 N. 47th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 05-29-2015)
Prior: 2863 North 12th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 05-29-2015 at 01:30pm
